page.title: 03Farming in Landscove
page.content: The soil here has much to do with the type of {farming. }It is mostly a red type of clay that encourages rich growth especially grass. The {dairy } farmers are able to take two or three crops of silage,as well as hay to feed their animals in the winter.The soil is also well-suited to the growth of kale and beet for winter feed.The farmers often use a low voltage electric fence to control the rate at which the animals feed you have to be careful of these if you have wet boots on. The Large tanker lorries visit the area every day to take away the milk that is produced by the Friesian cows.One or two farmers still have jersey{cows}but the total is only some 30 animals.{Sheep}are also reared and tend to graze the land that is too steep to farm or unsuitable for the cows .
